intro: Angelica porphyrocaulis f. latisecta, commonly known as the broad-leafed angelica, is a striking herbaceous plant characterized by its large, deeply lobed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. This variant is notable for its wide, flat leaves that contribute to its unique botanical profile.
